About.description: I am Raúl, a computer scientist with a solid background in mathematics. My specialty lies in the analysis and design of algorithms, combined with advanced skills in frontend and backend programming, which allows me to work as a full-stack developer. My experience extends to the application of machine learning techniques and artificial intelligence, with my thesis project being in this field. My methodological approach includes the use of agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban, which allows me to work efficiently and adaptably. I value the importance of maintaining clean, organized, and well-commented code, following the SOLID principles to ensure the quality, maintainability, and scalability of software.

professionalInterests: development of solutions in the field of machine learning and artificial intelligence
Interests.commitment: I am committed to creating optimal solutions.

skills.name: ReactJs
skills.info: I have a good command of the ReactJS framework, having created some projects here such as my portfolio and other web pages.

skills.name: Artificial Intelligence
skills.info: I have a good command of basic artificial intelligence, focusing more on the use of heuristics and metaheuristics.

skills.name: React Native
skills.info: I have worked on some personal projects with React Native and I manage well with this tool as it is very similar to ReactJS.

skills.name: Simulation
skills.info: My main focus in this field is based on intelligent agents and multi-agent systems.

skills.name: Machine Learning
skills.info: I have worked on projects related to this field such as the use of OpenAI's LLMs. I have also applied this knowledge to information retrieval using embeddings. Regarding training and model creation, I have experience with recurrent neural networks, transformers or attention layers, and convolutional networks. The main focus I have used in this skill is on images and natural language.

skills.name: .Net
skills.info: I have used the .NET ORM for simple personal projects and I have a good command of the C# language used in this environment.

skills.name: Information Retrieval Systems
skills.info: I have worked on projects related to this field combining it with the use of LLM and embeddings. I am familiar with this skill both with the use of generated vectors (like embeddings) and any type of vector or term-based retrieval. I also know data structures like TRIE perfectly to achieve the least temporal complexity in these types of problems. I am currently working on an OpenSource project in this field.

skills.name: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
skills.info: The design and analysis of algorithms is the basic skill of a computer scientist, we are highly prepared to design and analyze algorithms exhaustively and effectively, achieving the best possible computational complexities for each problem that arises.

projects.title: Image Retrieval System using Machine Learning
projects.description: This project focuses on developing an advanced Image Retrieval System (IRS) using machine learning techniques. It employs cutting-edge models like Segment Anything (SAM) and Constrative Language-Image Pretraining (CLIP) to create multimodal embeddings for precise image retrieval based on text queries. The approach involves image segmentation, multimodal embeddings generation, indexing process, and query processing to achieve high precision in image retrieval.

projects.title: Development of Intelligent Navigation Systems in Dynamic Environments
skills: Implementation of complex data structures with graphs
Optimization of search algorithms (A*, Real-Time A*)
Implementation of perception, spatial ordering, and collision detection techniques
Use of metaheuristics for algorithm optimization
projects.description: This project focuses on the creation of intelligent navigation systems for agents that interact with each other and are influenced by weather, seasonal, and terrain conditions. The main objective is to develop advanced algorithms to determine and simulate the optimal movements of these agents in complex and dynamically changing environments.

projects.title: Audio Genre Classification Project
projects.description: The Audio Genre Classification project aims to develop robust models for categorizing music tracks into predefined genres. It implements multiple feature extraction techniques, develops CNN and RNN models, utilizes the GTZAN dataset for evaluation, and conducts thorough model performance evaluations. The project discovers that song lyrics contribute minimally to classification accuracy and achieves state-of-the-art results with accuracies between 0.75 and 0.80.

projects.title: Devmman ChatBot
projects.description: The Devman ChatBot is an AI-powered conversational interface designed to enhance e-commerce product discovery by leveraging cutting-edge technologies. It utilizes embeddings for efficient similarity matching, Typesense for fast product searches, and the OpenAI GPT API for advanced natural language processing and generation capabilities. The project aims to revolutionize the shopping experience by providing enhanced customer search experiences and personalized product recommendations.

projects.title: 8 Colors Problem
projects.description: Given an array A that contains only elements of 8 different types, the problem consists in finding the maximum subsequence T, which satisfies the constraints: For every pair of sets Ci, Cj of elements of specific types, it holds that |Ci| - |Cj| ≤ 1. Elements of the same set have to be consecutive in T.

projects.title: Cool Compiler Project
projects.description: The Cool Compiler project focuses on developing a compiler for the Classroom Object-Oriented Language (Cool). This project aims to create a functional compiler that translates Cool programs into MIPS assembly code, demonstrating key concepts in compiler design and implementation. The project involves stages such as lexical analysis, syntax analysis, semantic analysis, intermediate representation generation, and code generation, utilizing Python as the primary implementation language.

projects.title: Distributed FTP System
projects.description: The distributed FTP system is designed to allow secure file transfers between nodes in a network. It is built to be resilient and scalable, capable of handling multiple simultaneous transfer requests without compromising performance. The Bully algorithm is central to this project, ensuring leader coordination among system nodes and minimizing service interruption during node failures.

projects.title: Information Retrieval System
projects.description: The IRS employs a vector-based approach to represent documents and queries in a multidimensional space. This allows for efficient similarity calculations using distance or cosine measures. Latent Semantic Analysis (LSA) is utilized to extract semantic features, addressing challenges like synonymy and polysemy. The system also incorporates Vaswani attention to capture complex word relationships, improving overall accuracy by considering broader contexts. A Trie structure is implemented for indexing and grouping documents, enabling near-instantaneous retrieval based on specific search patterns. This combination of techniques results in a robust and scalable information retrieval system capable of handling large volumes of data effectively.

projects.title: Building Roads Problem
projects.description: This project involves developing a solution to the 'Building Roads' problem, which has applications in network design, transportation systems, and resource allocation. The project focuses on implementing a suitable data structure for representing a weighted graph, determining edge selection strategies, ensuring vertex inclusion logic, and applying a greedy algorithm for optimization.

projects.title: Little Archemy Project
projects.description: Little Archemy is a novel project that brings together web development, bot technology, and mathematical concepts to create an engaging and educational platform. It utilizes Django for backend development, implements a Telegram bot for user interaction, and simulates the creation of mathematical elements through virtual alchemical processes.

projects.title: Yugi Oh Backend Application
projects.description: This project focuses on creating a comprehensive backend application for managing Yu-Gi-Oh related data. It utilizes Django, a high-level web framework for Python, to build a robust and scalable solution for storing and manipulating information about players, cards, matches, and tournaments. The application includes features such as database management, RESTful API, CRUD operations, and specific data handling for Yu-Gi-Oh.
